verses.roman:
tabe bhaṭṭācārya tāre 'sambandha' kahila
śuni' ānandita vipra nācite lāgila

synonyms: tabe—thereafter; bhaṭṭācārya—Balabhadra Bhaṭṭācārya; tāre—unto the brāhmaṇa; sambandha kahila—explained the relationship; śuni'-after hearing; ānandita—being pleased; vipra—the brāhmaṇa; nācite lāgila—began to dance.
translation: Balabhadra Bhaṭṭācārya then explained the relationship between Mādhavendra Purī and Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu. After hearing this, the brāhmaṇa became very pleased and began to dance.
